alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 3:02PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...THUNDERSTORMs WITH HEAVY RAINFALL WILL IMPACT ALLEGHANY...NORTHWESTERN SURRY COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN NORTH CAROLINA AND SOUTHEASTERN GRAYSON COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN VIRGINIA THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 300 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstormS WITH HEAVY RAINFALL NEAR Stratford, or near Laurel Springs, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Heavy Rainfall on saturated ground. Flooding possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of poor drainage, low-lying, and normally flood prone areas. Elevated levels on area creeks and streams. Locations impacted include... Galax... Sparta... Independence... Ennice... Baywood... Stratford... and Scottville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
